Title: Storage Classes and Datatypes
Description: INTEGER. The value is a signed integer, stored in 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 8 bytes depending on the magnitude of the value.

Title: Storage Classes and Datatypes
Description: REAL. The value is a floating point value, stored as an 8-byte IEEE floating point number.

Title: Boolean Datatype
Description:
SQLite does not have a separate Boolean storage class. Instead, Boolean values are stored as integers 0 (false) and 1 (true).

SQLite recognizes the keywords "TRUE" and "FALSE", as of version 3.23.0 (2018-04-02) but those keywords are really just alternative spellings for the integer literals 1 and 0 respectively.
